qas.question: What is a Sangoma in Swaziland?
Why might one want to discover when consulting a sangoma in Swaziland?

answers.text: the cause of sickness or even death

qas.question: How does a sangoma in Swaziland communicate?
What is kushaya ematsambo used for?

answers.text: to determine the cause of the sickness

qas.question: Who is chosen by their chiefdom?
What ceremony involves the whole village?
Who puts their patients in a trance?
What is thrown to cure the sick?

context: <b5_0><b7_0>The Sangoma<b7_0/><b5_0/> is <a1_0>a traditional diviner<a1_0/> chosen by the ancestors of that particular family. The <a0_0>training of the Sangoma<a0_0/> is called "kwetfwasa". At the end of the training, <b6_0>a graduation ceremony<b6_0/> takes place where all the local sangoma come together for feasting and dancing. The diviner is consulted for various reasons, such <a2_0>the cause of sickness or even death<a2_0/>. His diagnosis is based on "<a3_0>kubhula<a3_0/>", a process of communication, through trance, with the natural superpowers. The Inyanga (a medical and pharmaceutical specialist in western terms) possesses the <b8_0>bone<b8_0/> throwing skill ("kushaya ematsambo") used <a4_0>to determine the cause of the sickness<a4_0/>.
